noun.description: A category to which people are assigned according to the extent to which their bodily physique conforms to a basic type (usually endomorphic, mesomorphic, or ectomorphic)
examples: somatotypes refer to the underlying physique and are not changed by overeating or training
the influence of age and somatotype

origin: 1940s: coined by W. H. Sheldon in Varieties of Human Physique.
